publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3712 Stuart McMillan: Full Steam Ahead for Wemyss Bay Station—That the Parliament welcomes the work being carried out by the Friends of Wemyss Bay Station who are a newly formed group of volunteers with a keen interest in and admiration for Wemyss Bay station; notes that the group has been granted the use of the empty accommodation at the station to use as a heritage site, and further notes that the group plans to collect and display photographs of the station in its Edwardian prime and has reintroduced floral displays as a reminder of the days when the station was famous for its displays of potted plants and hanging baskets. Supported by: Anne McLaughlin*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Bob Doris*, Jamie Hepburn*, Ross Finnie*
S3M-3712 Full Steam Ahead for Wemyss Bay Station (lodged on 16 March 2009) Bill Kidd*, Christine Grahame*

S3M-3712 Stuart McMillan: Full Steam Ahead for Wemyss Bay Station—That the Parliament welcomes the work being carried out by the Friends of Wemyss Bay Station, a newly formed group of volunteers with a keen interest in and admiration for Wemyss Bay station; notes that the group has been granted the use of the empty accommodation at the station to use as a heritage site, and further notes that the group plans to collect and display photographs of the station in its Edwardian prime and has reintroduced floral displays as a reminder of the days when the station was famous for its displays of potted plants and hanging baskets. Supported by: Anne McLaughlin, Rob Gibson, Bill Wilson, Bob Doris, Jamie Hepburn, Ross Finnie, Bill Kidd, Christine Grahame
S3M-3712 Full Steam Ahead for Wemyss Bay Station (lodged on 16 March 2009) Gil Paterson*, Annabel Goldie*
